name: Bacon Mashed Potato Bombs
description: Crispy crumbed mashed-potato balls wrapped in bacon and stuffed with mozzarella, deep-fried until golden.
keywords: bacon, potato, mashed potato, mozzarella, fried, party food
recipeIngredient: 5 medium potatoes (about 900 g), peeled (a little skin left is fine)
1/2 tsp ground black pepper (plus more to season)
1 tbsp barbecue spice (BBQ seasoning), or to taste
120 g mozzarella cheese, cut into 8 equal cubes
1 cup bread crumbs (any crumbs that coat well)
About 500 ml neutral oil, for deep-frying

recipeInstructions.text: Peel potatoes (doesn’t need to be perfect). Cut into evenly sized chunks so they cook quickly.
Boil potatoes in water with a pinch of salt for 15–20 minutes, until a knife slides in easily. Drain well.
Mash potatoes while warm. Spread out and let cool completely (about 1 hour).
Once cool, mix mashed potato with the egg, BBQ spice, salt, and pepper until evenly combined.
Divide mixture into 8 balls. Flatten each ball, place a mozzarella cube in the center, then seal and roll back into a smooth ball.
Roll each ball in bread crumbs to coat thoroughly.
Wrap 1 bacon strip around each crumbed ball (twist as you wrap to help it cling). Secure with a toothpick.
Heat oil to 180°C in a deep pot. Fry 2–3 bombs at a time for 2–3 minutes, turning, until golden-brown all over.
Drain on paper towels. Remove toothpicks before serving. (Optional: fry slightly longer if you want the cheese extra-melty—just don’t burn the bacon.)
